episodeTitle: Bubble Master Kalifa! The Soap Trap Closes in on Nami!
episodeTitleJapanese: 泡使いカリファ！ナミに迫る石鹸の罠
episodeTitleRomanized: Awatsukai Karifa! Nami ni semaru sekken no wana
description: Chopper in his Monster Point form easily defeats Kumadori but loses control and goes berserk, attacking even Franky. Meanwhile, Nami struggles against Kalifa's Awa Awa no Mi Devil Fruit powers that can drain strength. Luffy finally catches up with Spandam, Rob Lucci, and Robin in the Tower of Justice.

openingSong.title: Crazy Rainbow
openingSong.titleJapanese: クレイジーレインボー

events.title: Chopper Defeats Kumadori in Monster Point
events.description: Chopper in his massive Monster Point form completely overwhelms Kumadori, dragging him by the head after knocking him unconscious. The battle is entirely one-sided, with none of Kumadori's Rokushiki techniques able to affect the transformed Chopper. Chopper then throws Kumadori's body all the way across to the Courthouse building.
events.significance: Demonstrates the incredible power of Chopper's Monster Point transformation, showing it can easily defeat a CP9 agent with a Doriki of 810. However, it also sets up the dangerous loss of control that comes with this form.

events.title: Chopper Goes Berserk in Monster Point
events.description: After defeating Kumadori, Chopper loses complete control of his consciousness in Monster Point. He becomes unable to distinguish friend from foe, attacking Franky when he approaches. Franky narrowly avoids being crushed and realizes Chopper has gone completely wild.
events.significance: Reveals the major drawback of Monster Point - it causes Chopper to lose all reason and attack indiscriminately. This creates a crisis where Chopper has become a danger to his own allies and sets up the need for intervention in later episodes.

quotes.text: What the hell is going on with him?!
quotes.speaker: Franky
quotes.context: Franky's reaction to Chopper attacking him

events.title: Franky Discovers Key Number 4
events.description: Franky retrieves a key from the unconscious Fukurou, hoping it will unlock Robin's seastone handcuffs. However, he discovers it's Key Number 4, not the Number 2 key needed for Robin's handcuffs. He deduces that if Fukurou had Key 4 and Kumadori had Key 3, then the CP9 secretary woman (Kalifa) must have Key Number 2.
events.significance: Advances the plot by identifying where Robin's key is located, creating urgency for Nami's battle with Kalifa. This revelation connects the various CP9 battles to the central goal of rescuing Robin.

events.title: Nami Begins Battle with Kalifa
events.description: Nami confronts CP9 agent Kalifa in the Tower of Justice. Despite knowing Kalifa is a trained assassin with superior fighting abilities, Nami is determined to obtain the key to free Robin. The battle begins with both fighters sizing each other up.
events.significance: Marks the beginning of one of the most notable female-on-female battles in One Piece. Nami must overcome a significant power gap to defeat a CP9 member and retrieve the key needed to save Robin.

events.title: Kalifa Reveals Her Devil Fruit Powers
events.description: Kalifa demonstrates her Awa Awa no Mi (Bubble-Bubble Fruit) abilities for the first time in battle. She creates soap bubbles that don't just clean dirt, but can also 'clean' the strength and power from her opponents. The floor becomes covered in slippery bubbles that drain Nami's energy.
events.significance: First full demonstration of Kalifa's Devil Fruit abilities in combat. The power to drain strength makes Kalifa a formidable opponent and creates a unique challenge that Nami must overcome with strategy rather than pure power.

events.title: Kalifa Uses Soap Sheep Technique
events.description: Kalifa unleashes her Bubble Master: Soap Sheep (Hitsuji Gumo) technique, creating sheep-shaped bubbles that attack Nami. The bubbles relentlessly pursue Nami, weakening her with their strength-draining properties.
events.significance: Showcases Kalifa's creative and versatile use of her Devil Fruit powers. The technique demonstrates how she can shape her bubbles into offensive weapons.

events.title: Kalifa Uses Golden Awa (Golden Bubble)
events.description: Kalifa rubs her legs with soap, making them incredibly smooth, shiny, and slippery. She calls this technique Golden Awa. When Nami is affected by the bubbles, her body becomes too slippery to maintain balance or grip, causing her to collapse helplessly.
events.significance: Demonstrates another application of Kalifa's Devil Fruit, showing how she can apply the smoothing effect to make opponents completely immobilized. This puts Nami at a severe disadvantage.

events.title: Nami Uses Thunder Charge Technique
events.description: Nami demonstrates a new ability with her Perfect Clima-Tact, creating a Thunder Ball charged with electricity. She generates a thunder cloud on the ceiling, preparing for a lightning-based attack against Kalifa.
events.significance: Shows Nami's tactical adaptation and the evolution of her Perfect Clima-Tact techniques. This demonstrates her ability to use weather phenomena strategically even in an indoor battle.

events.title: Nami Uses Swing Arm Technique
events.description: Nami performs the Swing Arm technique by rotating her Thunder Charge-enhanced Clima-Tact like an anemometer. The weapon spins rapidly with high-voltage electricity flowing through it, creating a dangerous electrical barrier.
events.significance: Demonstrates Nami's growing proficiency with the Perfect Clima-Tact and her ability to combine techniques. This shows her evolution as a combatant capable of facing CP9 agents.

events.title: Kalifa Creates Soap Armor Defense
events.description: When Nami attempts to strike Kalifa with her Thunderbolt Tempo, Kalifa encases herself within a large barrier of soap labeled with CP9. The soap shield protects her from Nami's lightning attack, demonstrating both offensive and defensive applications of her Devil Fruit.
events.significance: Shows the versatility of Kalifa's Awa Awa no Mi, revealing she can use bubbles defensively as well as offensively. This makes her an even more formidable opponent for Nami.

events.title: Luffy Reaches Spandam, Lucci, and Robin
events.description: Luffy finally catches up with Spandam, Rob Lucci, and the captive Nico Robin in the long tunnel leading to the Gates of Justice. Luffy yells out Robin's name so loudly that the entire tunnel echoes. Robin looks back with a smile, knowing Luffy has come to rescue her. Lucci grins, eager for the confrontation, while Spandam panics.
events.significance: This is the crucial moment where Luffy catches up to Robin's captors, setting up the climactic confrontation with Rob Lucci. It represents the culmination of the Straw Hats' assault on Enies Lobby and brings Luffy face-to-face with CP9's strongest member.

quotes.speaker: Luffy
quotes.context: Luffy's shout that echoes through the tunnel upon catching up to Robin

events.title: Lucci Tells Spandam to Continue to the Gates
events.description: Rob Lucci calmly tells the panicking Spandam to take Robin and continue toward the Gates of Justice. Lucci states that he will handle Luffy, showing his confidence and eagerness to fight the Straw Hat captain. Spandam nervously agrees and continues forward with Robin.
events.significance: Sets up the one-on-one confrontation between Luffy and Rob Lucci while Spandam continues with Robin. This decision creates the structure for the upcoming epic battle and raises the stakes for Luffy.

quotes.speaker: Luffy
quotes.context: Luffy shouts Robin's name upon catching up to her captors

quotes.text: What the hell is going on with him?!
quotes.speaker: Franky
quotes.context: Reacting to Chopper's berserk Monster Point attacking him

themes.description: The episode explores the double-edged nature of power through Chopper's Monster Point. While it grants him incredible strength to defeat Kumadori, he loses all control and becomes a danger to his friends. This theme questions whether power without control is truly strength.
themes.symbolism: Chopper's Monster Point represents raw power without restraint, symbolizing how overwhelming force can be both salvation and destruction.

themes.description: Nami faces a CP9 agent with superior combat skills and a Devil Fruit that directly counters her fighting style. Despite being outmatched physically, she continues to fight using intelligence and strategy, embodying the Straw Hats' refusal to give up.
themes.symbolism: The soap that drains strength represents the obstacles that seem insurmountable, while Nami's weather techniques symbolize her resourcefulness and adaptability.

themes.description: Every Straw Hat member is pushing their limits and risking their lives to rescue Robin. The episode shows multiple battles happening simultaneously, all driven by the singular goal of saving their friend from the World Government.
themes.symbolism: Luffy's shout of Robin's name echoing through the tunnel symbolizes how far his voice and determination have carried him through the island.

themes.description: The search for the correct key to free Robin creates tension and urgency. Each CP9 member holds a key, representing how the enemy has fragmented and distributed the means of Robin's freedom, forcing the Straw Hats to fight on multiple fronts.
themes.symbolism: The numbered keys represent the systematic oppression of the World Government, while the search for the right key symbolizes the effort required to overcome tyranny.

characterSpotlights.development: Chopper successfully defeats a powerful CP9 agent but the victory comes at the cost of losing himself to his Monster Point transformation. This showcases both his incredible potential and the dangerous price of his ultimate form.
keyActions: Defeats Kumadori in Monster Point form
Throws Kumadori across to the Courthouse
Climbs up the tower while out of control

characterSpotlights.development: Nami demonstrates her growth as a combatant by facing a CP9 agent despite the power gap. She adapts to Kalifa's Devil Fruit abilities by using her Perfect Clima-Tact in creative ways, showing intelligence and determination over raw strength.
keyActions: Confronts Kalifa to obtain the key for Robin
Uses Thunder Charge to create storm clouds indoors
Employs Swing Arm technique with electrical enhancement

characterSpotlights.development: Kalifa fully displays her Awa Awa no Mi abilities for the first time in battle, showing both offensive and defensive applications. Her confidence and versatility make her a formidable opponent.
keyActions: Demonstrates Devil Fruit power to drain strength
Uses Soap Sheep technique to attack Nami
Applies Golden Awa to immobilize opponents
Creates soap armor to defend against lightning

characterSpotlights.development: Luffy's relentless pursuit finally brings him face-to-face with Robin's captors. His determination is unwavering despite knowing he must face the strongest CP9 agent.
keyActions: Catches up to Spandam, Lucci, and Robin
Shouts Robin's name through the tunnel

characterSpotlights.development: Franky retrieves a key and deduces the location of Robin's key through logical reasoning, showing his tactical thinking. He also narrowly avoids Chopper's berserk attack, demonstrating quick reflexes.
keyActions: Deduces that Kalifa has Robin's key
quotes: What the hell is going on with him?!

mangaDifferences.difference: The anime extends the scenes of Chopper's rampage in Monster Point, adding more footage of him throwing Kumadori and his interaction with Franky.
The anime adds additional exchanges between Nami and Kalifa showing more of Kalifa's Devil Fruit techniques and their effects on Nami.

trivia.fact: This episode has an IMDb rating of 7.9/10 based on viewer reviews, reflecting positive reception of the multiple battles and plot progression.

sources.title: One Piece - Awatsukai Kalifa! Nami ni Hakaru Sekken no Wana - IMDb

trivia.fact: Episode 293 adapts content from manga Chapters 407-408, showing both Chopper vs Kumadori's conclusion and the beginning of Nami vs Kalifa.
This episode marks the first full demonstration of Kalifa's Awa Awa no Mi Devil Fruit abilities in combat, introducing her unique power to 'clean' away strength.
The Crazy Rainbow opening (Episodes 284-325) was performed by Tackey & Tsubasa, a Japanese idol duo, and does not use footage from actual episodes.
This episode aired without an ending song, as Toei stopped airing endings from Episode 279 to Episode 1070, a unique period in One Piece's broadcast history.

sources.title: One Piece Music - One Piece Wiki

trivia.fact: Kumadori's Doriki level is 810, making him significantly stronger than average, but Chopper's Monster Point defeats him with ease, showcasing the transformation's incredible power.
